variant.question: Which of these statements about structural design principles is correct?

options.text: The safe life principle is based on the replacement of structure and/or components after a given number of cycles or airframe hours.
The damage tolerance principle assumes crack in structures or faults in components will never happen.
The fail safe principle is that structures and components will never fail during the life of the aircraft.
The fault tolerant design principle is that the structures and components will continue to function regardless of the failures.

variant.question: Which of these statements about structural design principles is correct?

options.text: The safe life principle is based on the replacement of structure and/or components after a given number of cycles or airframe hours.
The damage tolerance principle assumes cracks in structure or faults in components will never occur.
The fail safe principle is that structures and components will never fail during the life of the aircraft.
The fault tolerant design principle is that the structures and components will continue to function regardless of the failures.

variant.question:
For SAFE LIFE designed structural components:
1) there is more than one load carrying component.
2) one load carrying component is sufficient for a given load, provided it is strong enough.
3) the component is removed at the end of the calculated life time or number of cycles.
4) the design is based on the principle of redundancy of components.
The combination that regroups all of the correct statements is:

Which of these statements about structural design principles are correct or incorrect?
1) In structural design, FAIL SAFE implies the structure will never fail.
2) A SAFE LIFE structure is based on a declared time period or number of cycles.

options.text: 1) is incorrect, 2) is correct.
1) is correct, 2) is correct.
1) is incorrect, 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct, 2) is incorrect.

variant.question: The principle of safe life design is based on:

options.text: the replacement of a part after a given number of cycles or hours of use.
the regular inspection of the structure.
having sufficient strength after failure of one of the structural elements.
the existence of more than one load path.

variant.question:
Which of these statements about structural design principles are correct ?

1. Fail-safe implies multiple load paths.2. Safe life is the preferred design technique for aircraft.

options.text: 1 is correct, 2 is incorrect.
Both 1 and 2 are incorrect.
Both 1 and 2 are correct
1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.

variant.question: What is the purpose of redundancy in aircraft design?

options.text: Providing an alternative load path or source in case the prime load path or source fails.
Save weight by getting rid of unnecessary components.
Save costs by getting rid of unnecessary structure.
Save weight by getting rid of unnecessary structure.

variant.question: For a safe life designed structure

options.text: one load path is sufficient and the structural element is removed at the end of the life time or number of cycles.
there is more than one load path and the structural element is removed at the end of the life time or number of cycles.
there is more than one load path and the structure should be redundant.
one load path is sufficient and the structure should be redundant.

variant.question: In the context of airframe load path philosophies a FAIL SAFE component is:

options.text: a component incorporated in a large aircraft which is designed so that, following its failure, the remaining structure can withstand reasonable loads without failure until the damage is detected.
a component that has two operating conditions, safe and unsafe, and is designed so that following a failure it is in the safe condition.
a component that does not affect the structural strength of the aircraft.
a component that has a design fatigue life such that the probability of failure in that life is assessed as remote.

variant.question:
Which of these statements about structural design principles are correct?
1. Fail safe implies the structure will fail, when one component fails.
2. A safe life structure is based on use during a limited time period or number of cycles.

options.text: 1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.
Both 1 and 2 are correct.
Both 1 and 2 are incorrect.
1 is correct, 2 is incorrect.
